intro: Aeschynanthus albidus, commonly known as the white-flowered gloxinia, is a species of flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tubular, white flowers. The plant produces showy, fragrant blooms that are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Aeschynanthus albidus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
